segments.en: Numbered Discourses 1
8. Good Friends

segments.pli: “Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yena anuppannā vā kusalā dhammā uppajjanti uppannā vā akusalā dhammā parihāyanti yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, kalyāṇamittatā.
segments.en: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to skillful qualities, or makes unskillful qualities decline like good friends.

segments.pli: Kalyāṇamittassa, bhikkhave, anuppannā ceva kusalā dhammā uppajjanti uppannā ca akusalā dhammā parihāyantī”ti.
segments.en: When you have good friends, skillful qualities arise and unskillful qualities decline.”

segments.pli: “Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yena anuppannā vā akusalā dhammā uppajjanti uppannā vā kusalā dhammā parihāyanti yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, anuyogo akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ, ananuyogo kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ.
segments.en: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to unskillful qualities, or makes skillful qualities decline like pursuing bad habits and not good habits.

segments.pli: Anuyogā, bhikkhave, akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ, ananuyogā kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ anuppannā ceva akusalā dhammā uppajjanti uppannā ca kusalā dhammā parihāyantī”ti.
segments.en: When you pursue bad habits and not good habits, unskillful qualities arise and skillful qualities decline.”

segments.pli: “Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yena anuppannā vā kusalā dhammā uppajjanti uppannā vā akusalā dhammā parihāyanti yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, anuyogo kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ, ananuyogo akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ.
segments.en: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to skillful qualities, or makes unskillful qualities decline like pursuing good habits and not bad habits.

segments.pli: Anuyogā, bhikkhave, kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ, ananuyogā akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ anuppannā ceva kusalā dhammā uppajjanti uppannā ca akusalā dhammā parihāyantī”ti.
segments.en: When you pursue good habits and not bad habits, skillful qualities arise and unskillful qualities decline.”

segments.pli: “Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yena anuppannā vā bojjhaṅgā nuppajjanti uppannā vā bojjhaṅgā na bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchanti yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, ayonisomanasikāro.
segments.en: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that prevents the awakening factors from arising, or, if they’ve already arisen, prevents them from being fully developed like improper attention.

segments.pli: Ayoniso, bhikkhave, manasi karoto anuppannā ceva bojjhaṅgā nuppajjanti uppannā ca bojjhaṅgā na bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchantī”ti.
segments.en: When you attend improperly, the awakening factors don’t arise, or, if they’ve already arisen, they’re not fully developed.”

segments.pli: “Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yena anuppannā vā bojjhaṅgā uppajjanti uppannā vā bojjhaṅgā bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchanti yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, yonisomanasikāro.
segments.en: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to the awakening factors, or, if they’ve already arisen, fully develops them like proper attention.

segments.pli: Yoniso, bhikkhave, manasi karoto anuppannā ceva bojjhaṅgā uppajjanti uppannā ca bojjhaṅgā bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchantī”ti.
segments.en: When you attend properly, the awakening factors arise, or, if they’ve already arisen, they’re fully developed.”
“Loss of relatives, mendicants, is a small thing.

segments.pli: Etaṃ patikiṭṭhaṃ, bhikkhave, parihānīnaṃ yadidaṃ paññāparihānī”ti.
segments.en: Wisdom is the worst thing to lose.”
“Growth of relatives, mendicants, is a small thing.
Wisdom is the best thing to grow.
So you should train like this:
‘We will grow in wisdom.’
That’s how you should train.”
“Loss of wealth, mendicants, is a small thing.

segments.pli: Etaṃ patikiṭṭhaṃ, bhikkhave, parihānīnaṃ yadidaṃ paññāparihānī”ti.
segments.en: Wisdom is the worst thing to lose.”
“Growth of wealth, mendicants, is a small thing.
Wisdom is the best thing to grow.
So you should train like this:
‘We will grow in wisdom.’
That’s how you should train.”
“Loss of fame, mendicants, is a small thing.

segments.pli: Etaṃ patikiṭṭhaṃ, bhikkhave, parihānīnaṃ yadidaṃ paññāparihānī”ti.
segments.en: Wisdom is the worst thing to lose.”
“Growth of fame, mendicants, is a small thing.
Wisdom is the best thing to grow.
So you should train like this:
‘We will grow in wisdom.’
That’s how you should train.”
